page.title: 12Raynor Clough Wood
page.content: Our favourite wood was Raynor Clough. The wood is on the steep banks of a tributary of the Ewden Beck. The stream flows into More Hall Reservoir. Dappled sunlight filtered through the fresh leaves of beech, oak, sycamore, hawthorn and rowan.Yellow archangel, goosegrass,nettles,greater stitchwort,bluebells, bracken, heather,brambles and foxgloves grow here. There is a waterfall with a wooden bridge crossing the river just below. A dead log was inspected - it was covered in moss, lichen and other plants.
